title: A Goodnight Story
detail_text: <:th_ch0108/>So then, it gets funny from this point, but~.... Kanata?<:dt_line_end/><:th_ch0206/>Nnah, sorry. It seems like Kanata dozed off there....<:dt_line_end/><:th_ch0108/>Fufu, it was so much fun talking that it turned night already, huh. It’s a given you’ll get sleepy. Hey, Mari will count animals for you, Kanata♪<:dt_line_end/><:th_ch0206/>Really? Kanata will probably fall asleep at the third one, but Kanata still wants you to count them~<:dt_line_end/><:th_ch0108/>Then I’ll start, okay. One crocodile with a frog on its head....<:dt_line_end/><:th_ch0206/>Crocodile?<:dt_line_end/><:th_ch0108/>Ah, I thought that I should mix the continuation of my story earlier with counting the animals♪ Remember, it’s the time when Mari first went to play in Florida~<:dt_line_end/><:th_ch0206/>So there are crocodiles in Florida. Sounds scary~<:dt_line_end/><:th_ch0108/>There are usually small ones on the waterway by the side of the road. That’s why I often see them from the car. Alright, that’s enough of that, so close your eyes now.... Two crocodiles with a bird perched on his head, three normal crocodiles, a big fight between a bird that’s going after a frog and a crocodile that’s going after the bird~....<:dt_line_end/><:th_ch0206/>Wait<:dt_line_end/><:th_ch0108/>Eh?<:dt_line_end/><:th_ch0206/>Kanata is too curious about that story, so Kanata is wide awake now. It sounds really interesting, so let me hear it normally!<:dt_line_end/><:th_ch0108/>Of course! The part after this is also exciting~<:dt_line_end/><:th_ch0000/>Translated by SIFAStheatre and Idol Story<:dt_line_end/>
